net.hudup.core.data

Class ParamSql

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.hudup.core.data.ParamSql
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class ParamSql
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class represents a SQL statement having parameters, called parametric SQL. Recall that SQL is a formal language for accessing relation database. It has two internal variables such as variable sql which is a string specifying SQL statement in text and variable indexes specifying indices of parameters inside the SQL statement. The parametric SQL statement specified by the internal variable sql has many question masks. Each question mark indicates a parameter where real value is filled in when the parametric SQL statement is completed for accessing database. For example, following is the code snippet of update SQL statement on rating unit (rating table) with two parameters:
    UPDATE rating set rating=5 where userid=? and itemid=?"
    The two parameters are specified by two question marks and so variable indexes is {0, 1}. Such variable indexes is called parametric indexer.
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • sql

        protected java.lang.String sql
        This variable is a string specifying parametric SQL statement in text. The parametric SQL statement has many question masks. Each question mark indicates a parameter where real value is filled in when the parametric SQL statement is completed for accessing database. Indices of these question marks are specified by variable indexes.

      • indexes

        protected java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> indexes
        This variable called parametric indexer specifies indices of parameters inside the parametric SQL statement referred by the variable sql. The parametric SQL statement has many question masks. Each question mark indicates a parameter where real value is filled in when the parametric SQL statement is completed for accessing database. For ease of understanding, indices of these question marks are specified by this variable. This variable is a list and so if it is empty, the SQL statement has no parameter.

      • getIndexText

        public java.lang.String getIndexText(boolean isIncOne)
        Converting the parametric indexer into the string, for example "0,1,2".
        Parameters:
        isIncOne - if true, the first index in the parametric indexer indexes is 1. If false, the first index in the parametric indexer indexes is 0.
        Returns:
        text form of parametric indexer, for example "0,1,2".

      • createStatement

        Creating the SQL statement for database connection. This method is so special that it will be replaced or removed in the future.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        SQL statement for database connection.
